words.example: You need your passport to travel internationally.
words.example_trans: 你需要护照才能出国旅行。

dialogues.text: My passport expired last year, so I can't travel until I renew it.
You need a passport photo to apply at the post office.
I renewed my passport at the government office last month.

words.example: Some countries require a visa before entry.
words.example_trans: 有些国家入境前需要签证。

dialogues.text: He applied for a work visa to take a job in Canada.
I only need a tourist visa for my vacation to Thailand.
She received an immigrant visa to join her children abroad.
You must complete a visa application online or at the embassy.

words.example: You must show your boarding pass to get on the plane.
words.example_trans: 你必须出示登机牌才能登机。

dialogues.text: I showed my mobile boarding pass on my phone at the gate.
He printed his boarding pass at the airport kiosk.
The boarding time is printed clearly on the boarding pass.

words.example: The flight number helps you find the correct gate.
words.example_trans: 航班号可以帮助你找到正确的登机口。

dialogues.text: The flight info board shows all flight numbers and their status.
I’m on Flight AC123 to Toronto, departing in two hours.

words.example: Departure time is when the plane leaves.
words.example_trans: 出发时间是飞机离开的时间。

dialogues.text: Our departure was delayed because of heavy snow.
We waited at the departure gate for boarding to start.
The departure board says our flight is on time.

words.example: Check the arrival time to meet someone at the airport.
words.example_trans: 查看到达时间，以便在机场接人。

dialogues.text: We waited at the arrival terminal with flowers.
The international arrival from Beijing just landed.
My brother’s flight had a late arrival due to bad weather.

words.example: You must go through security before boarding.
words.example_trans: 登机前您必须通过安检。

dialogues.text: There was a long line at the security check.
You must remove liquids from your bag before screening.
I walked through the metal detector without setting it off.

words.example: Your boarding gate may change, so check often.
words.example_trans: 您的登机口可能会更改，请经常查看。

dialogues.text: We waited at the boarding gate for final instructions.
Our gate number was printed on the boarding pass.
We missed the flight because the gate was already closed.

words.example: Luggage refers to your suitcases and bags.
words.example_trans: Luggage 指的是你的手提箱和包。

dialogues.text: The airline lost my luggage during the transfer.
I only bring one small carry-on luggage for short trips.
The luggage tag helped the staff find my missing suitcase.

words.example: Pick up your suitcase at baggage claim after landing.
words.example_trans: 着陆后在行李领取处领取您的手提箱。

dialogues.text: The baggage carousel started moving after ten minutes.
My luggage was delayed, so I had to wait an hour.
I matched the claim tag to make sure it was mine.

words.example: Customs checks goods you bring across borders.
words.example_trans: 海关检查你携带过境的物品。

dialogues.text: You must declare goods like food or alcohol at customs.
The flight attendant gave us the customs form on board.
I walked through the green lane since I had nothing to declare.

words.example: The officer checks your documents when entering a country.
words.example_trans: 入境时，官员会检查您的证件。

dialogues.text: The immigration officer asked to see my passport and visa.
They wanted to confirm that I had a return ticket.
I told them my purpose of visit was to see my son.

words.example: You must declare food or valuable items at the customs.
words.example_trans: 您必须在海关申报食物或贵重物品。

dialogues.text: I filled out the customs declaration form truthfully.
You must declare money if it’s over $10,000.
He was fined for failing to declare imported goods.

words.example: A small bag you bring onto the plane.
words.example_trans: 你带上飞机的小包。

dialogues.text: My carry-on fit perfectly in the overhead bin.
All liquids in my carry-on were under 100ml.
I kept my purse as a personal item.

words.example: You check in at the airport to get your boarding pass.
words.example_trans: 您在机场办理登机手续以获取登机牌。

dialogues.text: I did my check-in online 24 hours before the flight.
We arrived early for check-in to avoid long lines.
I went to the check-in counter to drop off my luggage.

words.example: Domestic travel may only require an ID.
words.example_trans: 国内旅行可能只需要身份证。

dialogues.text: He showed his driver’s license at the gate.
I used my PR card for domestic identification.
She used her senior ID to get a discount on the train.

words.example: An itinerary lists your travel plans.
words.example_trans: 行程表列出了您的旅行计划。

dialogues.text: I printed my full itinerary with flights and hotel bookings.
The airline sent me an email confirmation right after booking.
My itinerary included sightseeing and family visits.

words.example: Airports have multiple terminals.
words.example_trans: 机场有多个航站楼。

dialogues.text: We arrived at Terminal 1 for international flights.
We took the shuttle bus from Terminal A to the hotel.
The domestic terminal was quieter than the international one.

words.example: Flights can be delayed by weather or technical issues.
words.example_trans: 航班可能因天气或技术问题而延误。

dialogues.text: A weather delay caused us to miss our connection.
Our flight had a mechanical delay and needed repairs.
The airline gave us food vouchers during the delay.

words.example: Check if your flight is on time.
words.example_trans: 检查您的航班是否准时。

dialogues.text: The flight status showed it was arriving on time.
We boarded early since the departure was on time.
Everything went smoothly because we arrived on time.

words.example: You might need to transfer planes during travel.
words.example_trans: 您可能需要在旅行期间转机。

dialogues.text: I had a transfer flight through Vancouver.
We needed a domestic transfer to get to the final city.
Signs at the airport helped us find our next gate.

words.example: A connecting flight is part of a longer journey.
words.example_trans: 中转航班是较长旅程的一部分。

dialogues.text: We had a short connection and had to run.
I missed my connection and had to rebook.
Using the same airline made my connection easier.

words.example: A layover is time spent between two flights.
words.example_trans: 中途停留是两次航班之间的时间。

dialogues.text: We had a long layover and visited a nearby museum.
An overnight layover meant we had to book a hotel.
We stayed in the airport lounge during the layover.

words.example: They help passengers on the plane.
words.example_trans: 他们帮助飞机上的乘客。

dialogues.text: The flight attendant helped me with my seatbelt.
They showed us safety instructions before takeoff.
I asked the flight attendant for hot water.

words.example: Protects you during travel in case of emergency.
words.example_trans: 在发生紧急情况时在旅行期间保护您。

dialogues.text: My travel insurance covered the cost of lost luggage.
The policy paid for my hospital visit abroad.
Travel insurance reimbursed us after the flight delay.

words.example: A cart is used to carry items while shopping.
words.example_trans: 购物车用于在购物时携带物品。

dialogues.text: I pushed the shopping cart around the store while picking out groceries.
After unloading, I returned the cart to the parking lot station.
Some stores require a coin to unlock a shopping cart.

words.example: A basket is a small container for carrying items by hand.
words.example_trans: 篮子是一个用于用手携带物品的小容器。

dialogues.text: I used a hand basket for quick shopping at the corner store.
There were plastic baskets stacked at the store entrance.
My basket was full, so I went straight to checkout.

words.example: A cashier helps customers pay for their purchases.
words.example_trans: 收银员帮助顾客支付购买的商品。

dialogues.text: The friendly cashier greeted me and scanned all my items.
There was a long line waiting for the cashier during rush hour.
I smiled and said thank you to the cashier.

words.example: A receipt is proof of your purchase.
words.example_trans: 收据是您购买的凭证。

dialogues.text: I kept the receipt in case I needed to return the item.
The printed receipt showed every item I bought and the total.
I asked for the email receipt to save paper.

words.example: A credit card is a plastic card used for payment.
words.example_trans: 信用卡是一种用于支付的塑料卡。

dialogues.text: I swiped my credit card at the machine to pay.
She tapped her contactless card to complete the transaction.
I checked my credit limit before making a large purchase.

words.example: A debit card lets you pay directly from your bank account.
words.example_trans: 借记卡可让您直接从您的银行帐户付款。

dialogues.text: I used my debit card at the grocery store today.
I entered my PIN at the terminal for extra security.
After payment, I checked the balance in my bank account.

words.example: A sale offers items at reduced prices.
words.example_trans: 促销活动以降低的价格提供商品。

dialogues.text: I bought oranges on sale for half the regular price.
The store had a holiday sale with big discounts.
I found a red sale sticker on the shampoo bottle.

words.example: A discount reduces the regular price of an item.
words.example_trans: 折扣会降低商品的正价。

dialogues.text: I asked if there was a senior discount on Wednesdays.
I used a discount code when ordering online groceries.
The yogurt was on a buy-one-get-one discount deal.

words.example: The price tells you how much something costs.
words.example_trans: 价格告诉你某物的成本。

dialogues.text: I compared prices between two brands of rice.
The price tag showed a special offer.
I asked the cashier about the price since it wasn’t labeled.

words.example: An aisle is a walkway between shelves in a store.
words.example_trans: 过道是商店中货架之间的通道。

dialogues.text: I found the cooking oil in aisle five.
The aisle number was written on the sign above.
I walked down the snack aisle to find crackers.

words.example: Frozen food is kept in the freezer to stay fresh.
words.example_trans: 冷冻食品保存在冰箱中以保持新鲜。

dialogues.text: I bought frozen dumplings for a quick lunch.
Frozen vegetables are good for stir-fry and easy to store.
At home, I kept everything frozen until cooking time.

words.example: Dairy includes milk, cheese, yogurt, and other milk products.
words.example_trans: 乳制品包括牛奶、奶酪、酸奶和其他牛奶产品。

dialogues.text: I bought milk and cheese from the dairy section.
The dairy aisle was the coldest part of the store.
I chose lactose-free milk to avoid stomach discomfort.

words.example: Vegetables are plants eaten as food.
words.example_trans: 蔬菜是作为食物食用的植物。

dialogues.text: I bought fresh vegetables for tonight’s dinner.
I picked organic vegetables with no pesticides.
I always wash vegetables before cooking.

words.example: Fruit is the sweet part of a plant that we eat.
words.example_trans: 水果是我们吃的植物的甜味部分。

dialogues.text: Seasonal fruit like peaches and cherries taste best in summer.
I checked that the mangoes were ripe before buying.
Cut fruit was sold in clear plastic boxes for convenience.

words.example: Meat is animal flesh eaten as food.
words.example_trans: 肉是作为食物食用的动物肉。

dialogues.text: I used ground meat to make dumpling filling.
I bought sliced meat for hotpot night.
I stored the frozen meat in the freezer.

words.example: Fish is a type of seafood.
words.example_trans: 鱼是一种海鲜。

dialogues.text: I bought fresh fish displayed on ice at the seafood counter.
Frozen fish was cheaper and easier to store.
I bought fish fillets because they had no bones.

words.example: A bakery sells bread, cakes, and baked goods.
words.example_trans: 面包店出售面包、蛋糕和烘焙食品。

dialogues.text: I stopped at the bakery to buy fresh bread.
The bakery section smelled wonderful near the store entrance.
I picked up sweet buns for breakfast tomorrow.

words.example: Canned food is preserved in a metal container.
words.example_trans: 罐头食品保存在金属容器中。

dialogues.text: I bought canned soup for a quick and easy meal.
Canned fruit lasts longer than fresh fruit.
Canned tuna is great for sandwiches or salads.

words.example: A package is how a product is wrapped or boxed.
words.example_trans: 包装是产品包装或装箱的方式。

dialogues.text: I chose a small package of rice just for myself.
The family pack of tissues was more economical.
I opened the package carefully to check for damage.

words.example: A bottle holds liquids like drinks or sauces.
words.example_trans: 瓶子装有饮料或酱汁等液体。

dialogues.text: I carried a water bottle to stay hydrated.
The juice bottle was in the refrigerated section.
I handled the glass bottle with care.

words.example: A bag holds your items and helps carry them.
words.example_trans: 袋子装有您的物品并有助于携带它们。

dialogues.text: I paid 10 cents for a plastic bag at checkout.
I always bring a reusable bag when I shop.
They offered paper bags as a more eco-friendly choice.

words.example: Organic means grown without synthetic chemicals.
words.example_trans: 有机意味着不使用合成化学物质种植。

dialogues.text: I chose organic apples to avoid pesticides.
I looked for the organic label on every product.
The organic milk was in a special section of the dairy aisle.

words.example: Fresh means recently made, picked, or cooked.
words.example_trans: 新鲜意味着最近制作、采摘或烹饪。

dialogues.text: The fresh produce looked colorful and healthy.
I bought freshly baked bread from the bakery.
I go early to get the freshest fish.

words.example: Expired means the product is past its safe date.
words.example_trans: 过期意味着产品已超过其安全日期。

dialogues.text: I checked the expiry date on the yogurt.
The milk was expired and smelled bad.
I threw away the expired noodles from the pantry.

words.example: A refund is money returned after a return or complaint.
words.example_trans: 退款是在退货或投诉后退还的钱。

dialogues.text: I requested a refund because the fruit was rotten.
I brought the receipt to the customer service desk.
They offered a cash refund or store credit.

words.example: A bus stop is where people wait to catch the bus.
words.example_trans: 公交车站是人们等待乘坐公共汽车的地方。

dialogues.text: I waited at the bus stop near the pharmacy.
The sign showed when the next bus would arrive.
There was a bench at the bus stop for seniors.

words.example: A subway is an underground train used in big cities.
words.example_trans: 地铁是大型城市使用的地下火车。

dialogues.text: I took the subway downtown to visit my daughter.
The subway was crowded during rush hour.
I held the handrail while the subway was moving.

words.example: A train is a long vehicle that moves on tracks.
words.example_trans: 火车是一种在轨道上行驶的长车。

dialogues.text: I boarded the train at Central Station.
The train ride was fast and comfortable.
The ticket agent helped me find my train platform.

words.example: A ticket is proof you paid for your ride.
words.example_trans: 票是您支付车费的证明。

dialogues.text: I bought a train ticket online before leaving home.
You must show your bus ticket when you board.
I lost my subway ticket and had to buy a new one.

words.example: A transfer lets you switch from one route to another.
words.example_trans: 换乘可让您从一条路线切换到另一条路线。

dialogues.text: I transferred from the bus to the subway.
The driver gave me a paper transfer slip.
You must transfer within 90 minutes to avoid paying again.

words.example: A station is where passengers board or leave trains or buses.
words.example_trans: 车站是乘客上下火车或公共汽车的地方。

dialogues.text: We waited for the train at the main station.
The bus station had a waiting room and a café.
The metro station had signs in French and English.

words.example: A schedule tells you when buses or trains arrive.
words.example_trans: 时间表告诉您公共汽车或火车何时到达。

dialogues.text: I checked the bus schedule before leaving the house.
The printed schedule was posted at the stop.
Their weekend schedule is different from weekdays.

words.example: A route is the path a bus or train takes.
words.example_trans: 路线是公共汽车或火车采取的路径。

dialogues.text: I took the same bus route every day to the market.
Route 24 goes directly to Chinatown.
I asked the driver if the route stops near my building.

words.example: A map shows directions and where places are.
words.example_trans: 地图显示方向和地点位置。

dialogues.text: I used the transit map to find the right subway line.
The map at the station was easy to read.
She showed me a map of all the city’s bus routes.

words.example: A direction is the way you are going.
words.example_trans: 方向是您前进的方向。

dialogues.text: The train was going in the opposite direction.
I asked for directions to the nearest supermarket.
We headed in the wrong direction and got off early.

words.example: North is one of the four main directions.
words.example_trans: 北是四个主要方向之一。

dialogues.text: The bus headed north toward the mountains.
The northbound train leaves every 15 minutes.
I checked the map and walked north on Main Street.

words.example: South is one of the four main directions.
words.example_trans: 南是四个主要方向之一。

dialogues.text: We took the southbound bus to the airport.
My cousin lives in the south part of the city.
The sun is strongest in the south-facing garden.

words.example: East is one of the four main directions.
words.example_trans: 东是四个主要方向之一。

dialogues.text: I took the eastbound line to the museum.
The east side of the city is quieter.
The train heading east was delayed by 10 minutes.

words.example: West is one of the four main directions.
words.example_trans: 西是四个主要方向之一。

dialogues.text: I got lost going west and had to turn around.
The westbound tram stops right in front of my apartment.
We live on the west side of downtown.

words.example: A driver drives the car.
words.example_trans: 司机驾驶汽车。

dialogues.text: The bus driver greeted every passenger with a smile.
The driver waited for an elderly man to sit down.
I thanked the driver before getting off the bus.

words.example: A passenger is someone riding in a vehicle.
words.example_trans: 乘客是乘坐车辆的人。

dialogues.text: There were many passengers on the subway during rush hour.
The passenger next to me offered me a seat.
All passengers must wear a mask on public transit.

words.example: A fare is the money you pay for a ride.
words.example_trans: 车费是您为乘车支付的钱。

dialogues.text: I paid the bus fare with exact change.
Seniors get a reduced fare with their ID.
You must show your fare when requested by an inspector.

words.example: A metro card is a reusable transit pass.
words.example_trans: 地铁卡是一种可重复使用的交通卡。

dialogues.text: I topped up my metro card before leaving.
The metro card works on buses and the subway.
She keeps her metro card in a separate wallet slot.

words.example: To pay is to give money for something.
words.example_trans: 支付是为了给某物付钱。

dialogues.text: I pay cash on the bus when I don’t have my card.
You can also pay with your phone at the station.
We paid for two tickets at the counter.

words.example: To get on is to enter a bus, train, or subway.
words.example_trans: 上车是进入公共汽车、火车或地铁。

dialogues.text: I got on the bus at the main square.
He got on the train just before the doors closed.
They got on the wrong subway and had to switch.

words.example: To get off is to leave a vehicle.
words.example_trans: 下车是离开车辆。

dialogues.text: We got off the bus near the hospital.
I reminded my mom to get off at the third stop.
Everyone got off at the final station.

words.example: The next stop is the following place where the bus or train stops.
words.example_trans: 下一站是公共汽车或火车停靠的下一个地方。

dialogues.text: The screen showed “next stop: Saint-Laurent.”
I pressed the button when my next stop was coming.
He asked the driver where the next stop would be.

words.example: The final stop is the station at the end of the line.
words.example_trans: 终点站是线路末端的车站。

dialogues.text: The final stop is the station at the end of the line.
We had to get off at the final stop and wait.
The bus driver checked the bus after the final stop.

words.example: A delay means the vehicle is late.
words.example_trans: 延误意味着车辆晚点。

dialogues.text: There was a delay due to road construction.
We waited ten extra minutes because of the delay.
The train was delayed by a signal issue.

words.example: Accessible means easy to use for people with disabilities or mobility issues.
words.example_trans: 无障碍意味着残疾人或行动不便的人可以轻松使用。

dialogues.text: The accessible bus had a ramp for wheelchairs.
The station had elevators and accessible signs.
Accessible seating was marked at the front of the subway.
